definition: to wander about unhurriedly/to linger/to loiter

sentences.english: I am rather fond of a solitary stroll in the country.
sentences.chinese: 我頗喜歡在鄉間獨自徜徉。

sentences.english: Walking along the bank of Danube, enjoying the relaxing life of Hungary.
sentences.chinese: 徜徉在藍色多瑙河畔，盡享匈牙利的奢侈慢生活。

sentences.english: At night he roamed the deserted campus .
sentences.chinese: 夜晚他在杳無人跡的校園裏四處徜徉。

sentences.english: Where are the green fields, that we used to roam?
sentences.chinese: 我們，曾是徜徉在那綠地上情侶。

sentences.english: Dalliance mountains in China, you can completely blend together with nature.
sentences.chinese: 在青山綠水中徜徉，你完全可與大自然交融在一起。

sentences.english: The cloud is fluttering with the wind, roams through the vast sky ;
sentences.chinese: 雲兒隨風飄蕩，徜徉於無際的天空。

sentences.english: Pisces is quieter, more involved in the shifting of their own mindscape.
sentences.chinese: 雙魚則更爲安靜，更喜歡在自己的精神世界裏面徜徉。

sentences.english: Down in the Pettey Garden we're roving.
I never felt lonely while walked under the flower trees alone.
sentences.chinese: 花枝爛漫，即便一人獨自徜徉未覺寂寞。

sentences.english: So Hing Lake of All of a sudden have a, driving securinine Adventures, 10000 ares beautiful waves.
sentences.chinese: 於是遊湖之興頓生，駕一葉輕舟，徜徉萬頃波濤。

sentences.english: At night he roamed the deserted campus.
sentences.chinese: 夜晚他在杳無人跡的校園裏四處徜徉。

sentences.english: Let others delight mid new pleasures to roam.
sentences.chinese: 就讓他人在新的遊園中享受徜徉的歡樂吧。

sentences.english: We all walk under the same moon.
sentences.chinese: 我們都徜徉於同一片月光中。

sentences.english: I am here , where are you?
sentences.chinese: 雲之彼端，嘿，是誰在徜徉。

definition: to travel/to go on a tour/to roam
to loiter (i.e. reluctant to leave)/to linger on
to go through/to bore through/to push one's way through
to linger/to remain enjoying oneself and forget to go home
to travel back and forth/to shuttle
to be infatuated with/to be drunk with/to be enchanted with/to revel in
